sub_topic: Predicting the acidity or basicity of a molecule
message_1: What is the acidity or basicity of a molecule with the chemical formula HCOOH?
message_2: HCOOH, also known as formic acid, is an acidic molecule. It is a weak acid that can donate a proton (H+) to a solution, increasing the concentration of H+ ions and thus lowering the pH. The acidic nature of formic acid is due to the presence of the carboxyl group (-COOH), which is a common feature in many organic acids.
